result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua I Walcott

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:11 PM Defendant Joshua I Walcott in court.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Claire Elisabeth Barth in court for Joshua I Walcott.   Defendant wishes to proceed to preliminary examination.  State asks the Court to take judicial notice of case no. 20CF67 and recites the bail conditions in that matter on the record.  Sgt Joel Campbell of the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department is sworn in and testifies.  Defendant is identified for purposes of the preliminary examination.  State begins direct examination.  3:12 p.m. State rests 3:17 p.m.  Cross-examination begins at 3:19 p.m.   Cross examination ends at 3:21 p.m.  Witness is dismissed.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds the Defendant over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for June 17, 2022.  Scheduling conference is set for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 a.m.   .
Minutes.

3:30 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua I Walcott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing for the defendant, by zoom.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond.  Defendant refused to sign bail bond.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
